domains.name: Domains
domains.full_description: Foreman considers a domain and a DNS zone as the same thing. That is, if you are planning to manage a site where all the machines are of the form hostname.somewhere.com then the domain is somewhere.com. This allows Foreman to associate a puppet variable with a domain/site and automatically append this variable to all external node requests made by machines at that site.

params.name: location_id
params.description: Set the current location context for the request

params.name: organization_id
params.description: Set the current organization context for the request

params.name: host_id
params.description: ID or name of host

params.name: interface
params.description: interface information

params.name: mac
params.description: MAC address of interface. Required for managed interfaces on bare metal.

params.name: ip
params.description: IPv4 address of interface

params.name: ip6
params.description: IPv6 address of interface

params.name: type
params.description: Interface type, e.g. bmc. Default is interface

params.name: name
params.description: Interface’s DNS name

params.name: subnet_id
params.description: Foreman subnet ID of IPv4 interface

params.name: subnet6_id
params.description: Foreman subnet ID of IPv6 interface

params.name: domain_id
params.description: Foreman domain ID of interface. Required for primary interfaces on managed hosts.

params.name: identifier
params.description: Device identifier, e.g. eth0 or eth1.1

params.name: managed
params.description: Should this interface be managed via DHCP and DNS smart proxy and should it be configured during provisioning?

params.name: primary
params.description: Should this interface be used for constructing the FQDN of the host? Each managed hosts needs to have one primary interface.

params.name: provision
params.description: Should this interface be used for TFTP of PXELinux (or SSH for image-based hosts)? Each managed hosts needs to have one provision interface.

params.name: username
params.description: Only for BMC interfaces.

params.name: password
params.description: Only for BMC interfaces.

params.name: provider
params.description: Interface provider, e.g. IPMI. Only for BMC interfaces.

params.name: virtual
params.description: Alias or VLAN device

params.name: tag
params.description: VLAN tag, this attribute has precedence over the subnet VLAN ID. Only for virtual interfaces.

params.name: mtu
params.description: MTU, this attribute has precedence over the subnet MTU.

params.name: attached_to
params.description: Identifier of the interface to which this interface belongs, e.g. eth1. Only for virtual interfaces.

params.name: mode
params.description: Bond mode of the interface, e.g. balance-rr. Only for bond interfaces.

params.name: attached_devices
params.description: Identifiers of attached interfaces, e.g. ['eth1', 'eth2']. For bond interfaces those are the slaves. Only for bond and bridges interfaces.
params.validator: Must be an array of any type

params.name: bond_options
params.description: Space separated options, e.g. miimon=100. Only for bond interfaces.

params.name: compute_attributes
params.description: Additional compute resource specific attributes for the interface.

params.name: path
params.description:
The path to the medium, can be a URL or a valid NFS server (exclusive of the architecture).

for example http://mirror.centos.org/centos/$version/os/$arch where $arch will be substituted for the host’s actual OS architecture and $version, $major and $minor will be substituted for the version of the operating system.

Solaris and Debian media may also use $release.

params.description: The method used to provision the host.

params.validator: Must be an Array of nested elements

params.name: id
params.description: ID of interface

params.name: mac
params.description: MAC address of interface. Required for managed interfaces on bare metal.

params.name: ip
params.description: IPv4 address of interface

params.name: ip6
params.description: IPv6 address of interface

params.name: type
params.description: Interface type, e.g. bmc. Default is interface

params.name: name
params.description: Interface’s DNS name

params.name: subnet_id
params.description: Foreman subnet ID of IPv4 interface

params.name: subnet6_id
params.description: Foreman subnet ID of IPv6 interface

params.name: domain_id
params.description: Foreman domain ID of interface. Required for primary interfaces on managed hosts.

params.name: identifier
params.description: Device identifier, e.g. eth0 or eth1.1

params.name: managed
params.description: Should this interface be managed via DHCP and DNS smart proxy and should it be configured during provisioning?

params.name: primary
params.description: Should this interface be used for constructing the FQDN of the host? Each managed hosts needs to have one primary interface.

params.name: provision
params.description: Should this interface be used for TFTP of PXELinux (or SSH for image-based hosts)? Each managed hosts needs to have one provision interface.

params.name: username
params.description: Only for BMC interfaces.

params.name: password
params.description: Only for BMC interfaces.

params.name: provider
params.description: Interface provider, e.g. IPMI. Only for BMC interfaces.

params.name: virtual
params.description: Alias or VLAN device

params.name: tag
params.description: VLAN tag, this attribute has precedence over the subnet VLAN ID. Only for virtual interfaces.

params.name: mtu
params.description: MTU, this attribute has precedence over the subnet MTU.

params.name: attached_to
params.description: Identifier of the interface to which this interface belongs, e.g. eth1. Only for virtual interfaces.

params.name: mode
params.description: Bond mode of the interface, e.g. balance-rr. Only for bond interfaces.

params.name: attached_devices
params.description: Identifiers of attached interfaces, e.g. ['eth1', 'eth2']. For bond interfaces those are the slaves. Only for bond and bridges interfaces.
params.validator: Must be an array of any type

params.name: bond_options
params.description: Space separated options, e.g. miimon=100. Only for bond interfaces.

params.name: compute_attributes
params.description: Additional compute resource specific attributes for the interface.

params.name: compute_attributes
params.description: Additional compute resource specific attributes.

params.name: overwrite
params.description: Overwrite existing host (true by default)

params.description: Set the current location context for the request

params.name: ip
params.description: IPv4 address, not required if using a subnet with DHCP proxy

params.name: ip6
params.description: IPv6 address, not required if using a subnet with DHCP proxy

params.name: mac
params.description: required for managed host that is bare metal, not required if it’s a virtual machine

params.name: domain_id
params.description: required if host is managed and value is not inherited from host group

params.name: operatingsystem_id
params.description: required if host is managed and value is not inherited from host group

params.name: subnet_id
params.description: required if host is managed and value is not inherited from host group

params.description: Host’s parameters (array or indexed hash)

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the parameter

params.name: value
params.description: Parameter value

params.name: parameter_type
params.description: Type of value

params.name: enabled
params.description: Include this host within Foreman reporting

params.name: managed
params.description: True/False flag whether a host is managed or unmanaged. Note: this value also determines whether several parameters are required or not

params.name: comment
params.description: Additional information about this host

params.name: interfaces_attributes
params.description: Host’s network interfaces.
params.validator: Must be an Array of nested elements

params.name: mac
params.description: MAC address of interface. Required for managed interfaces on bare metal.

params.name: ip
params.description: IPv4 address of interface

params.name: ip6
params.description: IPv6 address of interface

params.name: type
params.description: Interface type, e.g. bmc. Default is interface

params.name: name
params.description: Interface’s DNS name

params.name: subnet_id
params.description: Foreman subnet ID of IPv4 interface

params.name: subnet6_id
params.description: Foreman subnet ID of IPv6 interface

params.name: domain_id
params.description: Foreman domain ID of interface. Required for primary interfaces on managed hosts.

params.name: identifier
params.description: Device identifier, e.g. eth0 or eth1.1

params.name: managed
params.description: Should this interface be managed via DHCP and DNS smart proxy and should it be configured during provisioning?

params.name: primary
params.description: Should this interface be used for constructing the FQDN of the host? Each managed hosts needs to have one primary interface.

params.name: provision
params.description: Should this interface be used for TFTP of PXELinux (or SSH for image-based hosts)? Each managed hosts needs to have one provision interface.

params.name: username
params.description: Only for BMC interfaces.

params.name: password
params.description: Only for BMC interfaces.

params.name: provider
params.description: Interface provider, e.g. IPMI. Only for BMC interfaces.

params.name: virtual
params.description: Alias or VLAN device

params.name: tag
params.description: VLAN tag, this attribute has precedence over the subnet VLAN ID. Only for virtual interfaces.

params.name: mtu
params.description: MTU, this attribute has precedence over the subnet MTU.

params.name: attached_to
params.description: Identifier of the interface to which this interface belongs, e.g. eth1. Only for virtual interfaces.

params.name: mode
params.description: Bond mode of the interface, e.g. balance-rr. Only for bond interfaces.

params.name: attached_devices
params.description: Identifiers of attached interfaces, e.g. ['eth1', 'eth2']. For bond interfaces those are the slaves. Only for bond and bridges interfaces.
params.validator: Must be an array of any type

params.name: bond_options
params.description: Space separated options, e.g. miimon=100. Only for bond interfaces.

params.name: compute_attributes
params.description: Additional compute resource specific attributes for the interface.

params.name: setup_insights
params.description: Set ‘host_registration_insights’ parameter for the host. If it is set to true, insights client will be installed and registered on Red Hat family operating systems.

params.name: setup_remote_execution
params.description: Set ‘host_registration_remote_execution’ parameter for the host. If it is set to true, SSH keys will be installed on the host.
